climatePledgeFriendly.details: EWG Verified products are reviewed to ensure they are free from EWG’s known chemicals of concern and adhere to strict health standards.

features: One 32 oz. bottle of Avalon Organics Natural Nourishing Lavender Conditioner
Deeply nourishes and hydrates normal to dry hair
Certified organic formula made with plant-based botanicals and essential oils
No GMOs, parabens, harsh preservatives, synthetic colors or fragrances, phthalates or sulfates
Always cruelty-free, never tested on animals; recognized by the Leaping Bunny Program
body.description: Nourish and hydrate normal to dry hair with Avalon Organics Nourishing Lavender Conditioner. Made with plant-sourced botanicals and essential oils, this certified organic formula deeply moisturizes and replenishes every strand. Lavender essential oil, quinoa protein, aloe and vitamin E work together to gently condition and seal the hair cuticle, leaving it feeling smooth, shiny and touchably soft. This EWG VERIFIED conditioner is made with non-GMO ingredients and no parabens, harsh preservatives, synthetic colors or fragrances, phthalates or sulfates. It is also vegan and not tested on animals. Includes one 32 oz. bottle of Avalon Organics Nourishing Lavender Conditioner. Curated from nature’s pure resources, Avalon Organics NSF organic certified skin care, hair care and bath & body products are deep-rooted in a profound respect for the earth. Combining modern science with the botanical world, we constantly strive to perfect each formula, evolve expertise and deliver innovation. Searching out the beautifying benefits hidden within each plant, Avalon Organics thoughtfully develops formulas to not only nourish the body, but also nourish the mind and the soul.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Deep Rooted Beauty Curated from nature’s pure resources, Avalon Organics NSF organic certified skin care, hair care and bath & body products are deep-rooted in a profound respect for the earth. Combining modern science with the botanical world, we constantly strive to perfect each formula, evolve expertise and deliver innovation. Searching out the beautifying benefits hidden within each plant, Avalon Organics thoughtfully develops formulas to not only nourish the body, but also nourish the mind and the soul.

Driven by a dedication to organic agriculture and formula transparency, all Avalon Organics products are certified to the NSF/ANSI 305 Standard for Personal Care Products Containing Organic Ingredients*. Through this honest, transparent process, the Avalon Organics brand creates products that are safe, effective and conscious of the greater good. *Claim approval was given on April 11, 2011 from QAI with certificate ID C01655324-NSF3HNPC-5.

Humbled by a profound respect for all living beings, Avalon Organics products are vegan and cruelty-free.* The Avalon Organics brand never tests products on animals, and will only source ingredients that the supplier can document are not tested on animals. This commitment to kindness is represented by the leaping bunny logo that appears on product labels. *Cruelty free certified by the CCIC on October 1st, 2008

Avalon Organics Rosemary Shampoo, 32 fl oz Avalon Organics Rosemary Conditioner, 32 fl. oz Avalon Organics Shampoo, Clarifying Lemon, 11 Oz Avalon Organics Conditioner, Clarifying Lemon, 11 Oz More Hair Care Products from Avalon Organics Formulated for thin and limp hair, this shampoo, containing a medley of Rosemary Essential Oil, Quinoa Protein, Calendula, Aloe and Vitamin E, thoroughly cleanses hair while reinforcing volume from root to tip. Formulated for thin and limp hair, this conditioner, containing a medley of Rosemary Essential Oil, Quinoa Protein, Calendula, Aloe and Vitamin E, lightly conditions hair while reinforcing volume from root to tip. Restore natural highlights and shine to dull, lackluster hair with Avalon Organics Clarifying Lemon Shampoo. Restore natural highlights and shine to dull, lackluster hair with Avalon Organics Clarifying Lemon Conditioner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This Avalon Organics Conditioner Lavender is great
reviews.reviewText: Love this product and the smell is wonderful

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Healthy ingredients, nice shampoo
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a shampoo that didn’t have any harmful ingredients, or any unclean animal parts. I’ve been pleased with this shampoo. It does help keep my hair moisturized (along with the Avalon conditioner), and I plan on always using it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Thin and ineffective! Inferior compared to what it was!
reviews.reviewText: I will say 2 nice things about this product first. It's organic... yay. It smells fantastic... a real lavender scent. Besides these things, I found this conditioner to be absolutely useless and ineffective! I used to buy Avalon Organics shampoo and conditioner regularly some years ago and was VERY satisfied with them. The only reason I stopped using them is because our budget got really tight and I had to buy cheaper products. As I have been able to buy nicer products again, I wanted to give Avalon another try. Feeling I could trust that it was a good product, I made the mistake of buying a really big bottle of it on Amazon, excited to see the good value. First... I was not able to get the pump nozzle to release by turning it, no matter what I tried. So, I just used it by pouring it out the top. I was extremely surprised and disappointed to find that it was a completely different consistency than I remember (but same great smell). When I used it years ago it was nice and thick and I didn't have to use a huge volume of it to get good coverage for my hair. This stuff was so thin, I had to use handfuls of it just to feel it on my hair at all, and even with a huge volume applied, I felt like there was nothing in my hair. Even what was in my hair just ran and dripped off instead of being retained and letting my hair soak in it a little while. After I rinsed and got out of the shower, I was disgusted to find that, as I tried to brush my hair, not only was my hair dry and tangly, as if it has not been conditioned at all, but I began to notice a waxy build up on my hair brush, which I have never yet experienced! I would return it if my return window was not already closed. Now it will probably just go in the trash... a complete WASTE of money and resources!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great, but be aware of packaging
reviews.reviewText: I love this conditioner. It's a little on the liquidy side, not thick like conventional conditioners; however, it works fine. It's moisturizing and contains clean ingredients.However, do be aware of the packaging. Sometimes they ship it strapped to a cardboard piece in a box that it fits in perfectly. Other times they just throw it in a bag inside a box that it doesn't fit well in (in which case the cap breaks open and all the contents squeeze out).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product but didn’t have a seal on the bottle

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Like "Creme Rinse" of the past
reviews.reviewText: This lavender conditioner is more the consistency of "Creme Rinse" products I purchased many years ago (not sure they still make/sell creme rinses). It does detangle, but I don't feel it offers the moisturizing benefits of other brands (my hair is relatively healthy). The scent is wonderful, and the price is not bad. If you don't need a deep conditioner, this will work fine for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it for curly girl method - light bouncy shiny curls
reviews.reviewText: Great for curls. I only shampoo once a week to preserve my curls as part of the curly girl method and use this conditioner in place of a couple washes. I also use the matching shampoo when I do need a good scrub. After trying all the curl method options, I can use this as often as I like and it doesn’t destroy/dry out my curls or weigh them down between washes. I get tons of compliments since I’ve been using it and I’ve noticed my curls are shinier and bouncier/lighter weight than with other thicker (shea butter) conditioners. Very nice to see from a natural option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Dry brittle result, rosacea flare up
reviews.reviewText: In the quest for healthy, nourished hair, I recently tried the Avalon Organics Conditioner. Promising organic ingredients and a natural approach, I was hopeful for a transformative experience. However, what followed was an unexpected journey that left me with dried-out hair and a flare-up of my rosacea. Avalon Organics Conditioner boasts an impressive list of natural and organic ingredients on its label. These include essential oils that claim to provide deep hydration and revitalization for your hair. However, as they say, “the proof is in the pudding.” One of the most puzzling aspects of my experience was the conditioner’s effect on my hair. Instead of the expected silkiness and smoothness, it seemed to suck the moisture right out of my locks. This left my hair feeling dry and brittle, a far cry from the promised hydration. The real plot twist came when I noticed a significant worsening of my rosacea symptoms. It’s crucial to mention that I’ve had my rosacea under control for quite some time. However, the inclusion of essential oils in this conditioner seemed to trigger an unexpected rosacea flare-up, leaving my skin red, inflamed, and irritated. Intrigued by this unusual reaction, I decided to delve deeper into the product’s ingredients. It turns out that some essential oils, when applied topically, can exacerbate skin conditions like rosacea in certain individuals. This revelation added an unexpected layer to my experience. My journey with Avalon Organics Conditioner was indeed an eye-opener. While it may work wonders for some, it proved to be a gamble for my hair and skin. The drying effect on my hair and the unexpected rosacea flare-up left me baffled. It serves as a reminder that what’s labeled as “organic” or “natural” may not always be suitable for everyone. Before trying any new product, it’s essential to understand your own unique skin and hair needs. This conditioner may hold promise for some, but for me, it was an unexpected twist in my beauty routine.
Love the texture and fragrance. I didn’t use it for long enough to comment on the long term results.
The conditioner leaves my daughter’s kinky African hair detangled and soft. It works very well. Since it is thick, sometimes I don’t get it washed out properly though.
La bouteille est mal pensée car le liquide, plus épais, sort difficilement du petit trou.Et il faut utiliser pas mal de produit.
以前からこちらの無香料の物を使用して、良かったので、たまには香りがある物を使いたかったので購入。しかし、6千円台と、以前のものの2倍の値段。何故でしょう⁈コンディショナーは、ラベンダーの香りで三千円台と無香料とほぼ同じなので、納得が行かない。しかし、他に無いので買いました。早くシャンプーも三千円台に戻して下さい。
Después de utilizarlo me costó mucho peinarme, tenía unos nudos horribles.Además, después de un rato se va el olor a árbol de té en el pelo y huele bastante mal.
